thread.title: Heck yeah, we're from Denver: ProtectWise
thread.title_full: Heck yeah, we're from Denver: ProtectWise - The Denver Post

author: Tamara Chuang
title: Heck yeah, we're from Denver: ProtectWise
text:
There are security companies that patch known security holes in computers. Others tell you if your computers have been attacked. More advanced software may even tell you when the network is under attack. But ProtectWise may be the only one that can show you how your computer network changed over time â€” just in case malicious attackers are so stealthy that they somehow elude even high-level government agencies and the FBI. ProtectWise, which has raised $17 million from investors, sells a DVR of sorts. But obviously this is not to record favorite TV shows. Its Cloud Network DVR records every change made to files over long periods of time to compare and contrast. The company also wanted to make it easy for IT folks to interpret the bad stuff, so it hired Jake Sargeant, the Hollywood visual effects designer behind the movie "Tron: Legacy" to come up with a game-ified display. Take that, super-stealthy, state-sponsored hackers!
Headquarters: 1555 Blake St., Denver
Founded: 2013
Founders: Scott Chasin, CEO; Gene Stevens, CTO
Employees: 30
Recent news: Named a Denver Gazelle for its fast-growing potential
Home on the Web: protectwise.com
